meanings.definition: To express support for or advocate a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: She was espousing the importance of recycling in her community.
meanings.sent2: Many people are espousing the idea of equality for all.
meanings.sent3: He kept espousing the benefits of eating broccoli at every meal.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were like espousing a flag for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passionate speech on kindness was espousing a message of empathy.

meanings.definition: To marry or give in marriage.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the prince was espousing the princess at the grand ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The couple decided to espouse each other in a beautiful garden wedding.
meanings.sent3: The two cats were espousing each other in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: Their love was like espousing two rivers merging into one.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of espousing in their culture was a symbol of unity and commitment.

meanings.definition: To take up or adopt as a cause, support, or belief.
meanings.sent1: The organization was espousing the fight against poverty in the city.
meanings.sent2: He was espousing the new technology as the solution to many problems.
meanings.sent3: The group was espousing the idea of having a pizza party every Friday.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was espousing the love for animals and nature.
meanings.sent5: The community was espousing a sense of togetherness during the difficult times.
